author: .paulharris
content:
i see some /v1 definitions are going into the published api! yay!
as a question on that, looking at https://ethereum.github.io/eth2.0-APIs/#/Node/getNetworkIdentity
the spreadsheet indicates the response will be wrapped in a data container, not just be an object response, is that still the plan or am i missing something?
peers has data, which i think covers the intent of what the spreadsheet is actually asking for...
to me the spreadsheet looks like it wants to have `{data: <RESPONSE>}` for basically every response body

author: mpetrunic
content: data wrapper is only used in array responses where we expect to have additional metadata like pagination. Any reason why we should put data wrap around everything?

author: mpetrunic
content: I kinda lean to not have it on single resource endpoints as it introduces additional non null checks and data is sometimes object, sometime array

author: jgm
content:
> data wrapper is only used in array responses where we expect to have additional metadata like pagination. Any reason why we should put data wrap around everything?
<@545555441518772225> I added this because it allowed additional fields in future e.g. a text-based status, metadata fields, etc. It isn't a lot of additional work for either server or client and gives future flexibility

author: .paulharris
content: the spec literally says everything will have data around it, and the examples in wg proposal all have data except for 2 validator endpoints. all the 'no duck typing' have data wrapping responses.

author: .paulharris
content:

<@!545555441518772225>  i do agree it is a bit of an antipattern, but thats the way the spreadsheet is going, just not sure whether to start moving endpoints or to hold off
